intro: Astragalus tetragonocarpus, commonly known as the four-angle fruit milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces unique four-angled pods, which are a distinctive feature of its botanical description. It is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in steppe and desert environments. Astragalus tetragonocarpus plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife in its native habitat.
